item.title: Heather add a quote by Wilkie Collins
item.description: "My hour for tea is half-past five, and my buttered toast waits for nobody." -- Wilkie Collins

item.title: Heather add a quote by Jennifer Crusie
item.description: "If you can't be a good example, you'll just have to be a horrible warning." -Gwen Goodnight" -- Jennifer Crusie

item.title: Heather add a quote by François de La Rochefoucauld
item.description: "No persons are more frequently wrong, than those who will not admit they are wrong." -- François de La Rochefoucauld

item.title: Heather add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Do not read, as children do, to amuse yourself, or like the ambitious, for the purpose of instruction. No, read in order to live." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Heather add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "When I despair, I remember that all through history the way of truth and love have always won. There have been tyrants and murderers, and for a time, they can seem invincible, but in the end, they always fall. Think of it--always." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Heather add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "You never have to change anything you got up in the middle of the night to write." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: Heather add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Heather add a quote by Nicole Krauss
item.description: "Once upon a time there was a boy who loved a girl, and her laughter was a question he wanted to spend his whole life answering." -- Nicole Krauss

item.title: Heather add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I would always rather be happy than dignified." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Heather add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Heather add a quote by Michael Crichton
item.description: "If you don't know history, then you don't know anything. You are a leaf that doesn't know it is part of a tree. " -- Michael Crichton

item.title: Heather add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Heather add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "Three things in human life are important: the first is to be kind; the second is to be kind; and the third is to be kind." -- Henry James

item.title: Heather add a quote by Henry Ward Beecherr
item.description: "Where is human nature so weak as in the bookstore?" -- Henry Ward Beecherr

item.title: Heather add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Heather add a quote by William Wordsworth
item.description: "Wisdom is oft-times nearer when we stoop Than when we soar." -- William Wordsworth

item.title: Heather add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "There are no good girls gone wrong - just bad girls found out." -- Mae West

item.title: Heather add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "It was a bright cold day in April, and the clocks were striking thirteen." -- George Orwell

item.title: Heather add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "The plain state of being human is dramatic enough for anyone; you don't need to be a heroin addict or a performance poet to experience extremity. You just have to love someone." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Heather add a quote by Richard Hughes
item.description: "Do your bit to save humanity from lapsing back into barbarity by reading all the novels you can." -- Richard Hughes

item.title: Heather add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Heather add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description: "People who claim that they're evil are usually no worse than the rest of us... It's people who claim that they're good, or any way better than the rest of us, that you have to be wary of." -- Gregory Maguire

item.title: Heather add a quote by Glen Cook
item.description: "Morning is wonderful. Its only drawback is that it comes at such an inconvenient time of day." -- Glen Cook

item.title: Heather add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "Always try to keep a patch of sky above your life." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Heather add a quote by Jean Kerr
item.description: "I make mistakes; I'll be the second to admit it." -- Jean Kerr

item.title: Heather add a quote by Percy Bysshe Shelley
item.description: "My name is Ozymandias, king of kings: Look on my works, ye Mighty, and despair!" -- Percy Bysshe Shelley

item.title: Heather add a quote by Edith Sitwell
item.description: "I have often wished I had time to cultivate modesty...But I am too busy thinking about myself." -- Edith Sitwell

item.title: Heather add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "If, then, I were asked for the most important advice I could give, that which I considered to be the most useful to the men of our century, I should simply say: in the name of God, stop a moment, cease your work, look around you." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Heather add a quote by Georges Bataille
item.description: "I believe that truth has only one face: that of a violent contradiction." -- Georges Bataille

item.title: Heather add a quote by Howard Nemerov
item.description: "Write what you know. That should leave you with a lot of free time." -- Howard Nemerov
